name: biomni-query-kegg
title: Biomni: Query Kegg
description: Query KEGG (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes) for pathway maps, enzyme information, and metabolic networks.
content:
Overview

Searches KEGG, a comprehensive database integrating genomic, chemical, and systemic functional information. KEGG contains manually drawn pathway maps for metabolism, genetic and environmental information processing, cellular processes, and human diseases across multiple organisms.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about pathways, genes, or compounds
  • endpoint (string, optional): Specific KEGG API endpoint
  • verbose (boolean, optional): Enable detailed logging output

Biological Use Case

Essential for metabolic pathway analysis, systems biology, and understanding gene function in context. Researchers use KEGG to map experimental data onto pathway diagrams, identify metabolic bottlenecks, discover enzyme functions, analyze flux balance, understand disease mechanisms involving metabolic dysregulation, and predict gene functions based on pathway context.

Output

Returns a parameters (kegg_results.json) containing pathway information including KEGG pathway IDs, pathway names, gene/enzyme lists, compound structures, reaction equations, pathway diagrams, organism-specific annotations, and cross-references to other databases.

Category

database
